name: Dinner Tonight: Chicken with Lemon
description: Yawnnn.... right? How can this possibly be any good? I mean, it's just lemons and chicken! Honestly, I never would have attempted this recipe from Craig Claiborne's New York Times Cookbook if I didn't have a whole stack of lemons and a chicken. Plus it looked easy. But it's remarkable how this can have so much flavor from so few ingredients.
recipeIngredient: 1 chicken, cut into 2 breasts and 2 legs, back and wings saved for another purpose
10 thin lemon slices, from about 2 lemons

recipeInstructions.text: Season chicken pieces with salt and pepper. Add butter to large 12-inch, heavy bottomed skillet set over medium heat. Add chicken pieces skin side down. Cook until skin is golden, four to five minutes. Flip pieces and cook until lightly browned on other side, about three minutes.
Sprinkle in shallots, and then place lemon slices on top of chicken pieces. Cook for five minutes.

Pour in wine. Cover skillet and cook until chicken is cooked through, about 15 minutes. Serve chicken with dripping from skillet. Rice would
be an appropriate side.
